article_caption: The International Space Station orbiting Earth

article_paragraphs.text: Living on the International Space Station (ISS) is very different from living on Earth. The ISS is a large laboratory that orbits our planet. Astronauts from many different countries live and work there together. They stay for about six months at a time.

The most amazing thing about space is that there is almost no gravity. This means that everything floats. Astronauts do not walk; they float from room to room. Eating and sleeping can be tricky. They have to strap themselves into sleeping bags so they do not float away while they dream.

Astronauts have a busy schedule. They spend a lot of time conducting scientific experiments. They study how space affects the human body and how plants grow without gravity. In their free time, they love to look out the window. They can see the beautiful blue Earth spinning below them.
